intro: Endostemon scabridus, commonly known as the rough endostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
